result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward J. Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

    Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $90 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required appropriate by the Agent
--to comply with Sex Offender Registration and reporting under Statute 301.45
--no direct or indirect contact with H.M.M.
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 

The Court orders Sex Offender Registration and reporting under Statute 301.45.

Statute 948.13 prohibition from employment or volunteer-work that involves children is imposed

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
cases #00CF269 and #14CF407 called at 2:52pm. [MK]
Defendant Edward J. Edwards in court with Attorney Philip J. Brehm.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
In Case #14CF407:
--Service of the Criminal Complaint admitted; reading waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
--Mr. Edwards waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--Service of Information admitted, reading waived. 
--ADA Shock provides information verifying that the charge falls within the Statute of Limitations.  Also, Attorney Brehm, and Mr. Edwards individually, each indicate that the Defense is waiving any issues as to the Statute of Limitations. 
--Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Edwards guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On agreement of the parties, the Court dismisses Case #00CF269 outright.

In Case #14CF407, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Edwards on Probation for 30 months, with conditions:
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required appropriate by the Agent
--to comply with Sex Offender Registration and reporting under Statute 301.45
--no direct or indirect contact with H.M.M.
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--to pay costs of $90 plus $250 DNA surcharge

The Court orders Sex Offender Registration and reporting under Statute 301.45.
On stipulation of the parties, the Court sets the days credit for time served in this Case #14CF407 at zero.

Contact Prohibition warnings/penalties given
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given 
Body Armor prohibition warnings/penalties given
Statute 948.13 prohibition from employment or volunteer-work that involves children is imposed; penalties recited 
recess 3:16pm.
Copy of Email from DA to COC re: scheduling
